title: DataswornSource v0.0.10
description:
Source data schema for Datasworn, which describes game rules compatible with the Ironsworn tabletop roleplaying game by Shawn Tomkin.

The source data omits IDs, and makes properties that provide a default value optional; these values are inserted during validation/processing to produce the JSON for distribution.

SourceRoot.title: SourceRoot
SourceRoot.description: The root object for a Datasworn source file, whose schema is discriminated by the `type` property. Unlike the JSON schema for distribution, this may be a standalone object (Asset, Npc, Move, OracleRollable, DelveSite, DelveSiteTheme, DelveSiteDomain, or Rarity), but it still must specify its `ruleset` and `datasworn_version`.

allOf.remarks: Deserialize as a discriminated union/polymorphic object type, using the `type` property as a discriminator.

datasworn_version.description: The version of the Datasworn format used by this data.

RulesPackage.title: RulesPackage
RulesPackage.description: Describes game rules compatible with the Ironsworn tabletop role-playing game by Shawn Tomkin.
RulesPackage.remarks: Deserialize as a discriminated union/polymorphic object type, using the `type` property as a discriminator.

Ruleset.description: A standalone Datasworn package that describes its own ruleset.

authors.description: Lists authors credited by the source material.

date.description: The date of the source documents's last update, formatted YYYY-MM-DD. Required because it's used to determine whether the data needs updating.

url.description: A URL where the source document is available.

oracles.description: A dictionary object containing oracle collections, which may contain oracle tables and/or oracle collections.

moves.description: A dictionary object containing move categories, which contain moves.

delve_sites.description: A dictionary object of delve sites, like the premade delve sites presented in Ironsworn: Delve

site_domains.description: A dictionary object containing delve site domains.

site_themes.description: A dictionary object containing delve site themes.

truths.description: A dictionary object of truth categories.

MarkdownString.title: MarkdownString
MarkdownString.description:
Localized text, formatted in Markdown.

It uses some custom syntax; e.g. `{{table:some_oracle_table_id}}` indicates that the referenced oracle table is rendered there in the source material.

PartOfSpeech.title: PartOfSpeech
PartOfSpeech.description:
- `common_noun`: A common noun.
  - `proper_noun`: A proper noun.
  - `adjunct_common_noun`: A common noun used as an adjective, to modify another noun.
  - `adjunct_proper_noun`: A proper noun used as an adjective, to modify another noun.
  - `verb`: A verb in present tense
  - `gerund`: Gerund or present participle of a verb, e.g. "going", "seeing", "waving". Can function as a noun, an adjective, or a progressive verb.
  - `adjective`: An adjective.
  - `attributive_verb`: A verb used as an adjective, to modify a noun.
  - `adjective_as_proper_noun`: An adjective used as a proper noun.
  - `common_noun_as_proper_noun`: An common noun used as a proper noun.

TemplateString.title: TemplateString
TemplateString.description:
A rich text string in Markdown with replaced values from oracle roll results.

The custom syntax `{{some_row_key:some_oracle_table_id}}` should be replaced by the `some_row_key` string of a rolled oracle table. This is usually the `result` key, for example `{{result:starforged/oracles/core/action}}`

ConditionMeterRule.title: ConditionMeterRule
ConditionMeterRule.description: Describes a standard player character condition meter.

rollable.description: Is this meter's `value` usable as a stat in an action roll?

min.description: The minimum value of this meter.

max.description: The maximum value of this meter.

value.description: The current value of this meter.

shared.description: Is this condition meter shared by all players?

description.description: A description of this condition meter.

ImpactCategory.title: ImpactCategory
ImpactCategory.description: Describes a category of standard impacts/debilities.

label.description: A label for this impact category.

description.description: A description of this impact category.

contents.description: A dictionary object of the Impacts in this category.

prevents_recovery.description: Any ruleset condition meters that can't recover when this impact is active.

shared.description: Is this impact applied to all players at once?

Rules.title: Rules
Rules.description: Describes rules for player characters in this ruleset, such as stats and condition meters.

condition_meters.description: Describes the standard condition meters used by player characters in this ruleset.

stats.description: Describes the standard stats used by player characters in this ruleset.

impacts.description: Describes the standard impacts/debilities used by player characters in this ruleset.

special_tracks.description: Describes the special tracks used by player characters in this ruleset, like Bonds (classic Ironsworn), Failure (Delve), or Legacies (Starforged).

SpecialTrackRule.title: SpecialTrackRule
SpecialTrackRule.description: Describes a special track like Bonds (classic Ironsworn), Failure (Delve), or Legacies (Starforged).

optional.description: Is this track an optional rule?

shared.description: Is this track shared by all players?

StatRule.title: StatRule
StatRule.description: Describes a standard player character stat.

examples: Quickness, agility, and prowess when fighting at a distance.

ChallengeRank.title: ChallengeRank
ChallengeRank.description:
Challenge rank, represented as an integer from 1 (troublesome) to 5 (epic).

  - `1`: Troublesome
  - `2`: Dangerous
  - `3`: Formidable
  - `4`: Extreme
  - `5`: Epic

ProgressTrackTypeInfo.title: ProgressTrackTypeInfo
ProgressTrackTypeInfo.description: Describes the features of a type of progress track.

category.description: A category label for progress tracks of this type.

SpecialTrackType.title: SpecialTrackType
SpecialTrackType.description:
Special, ruleset-specific progress tracks. Usually, one exists per player character, and they persist through the life of the player character.
'Canonical' examples:
  * `bonds_track`, described in the Ironsworn Rulebook. For the Starforged legacy track, use `bonds_legacy` instead.
  * `failure_track`, described in Ironsworn: Delve
  * `quests_legacy`, `bonds_legacy`, and `discoveries_legacy`, described Ironsworn: Starforged

AssetControlValueRef.description: A reference to the value of an asset control.

control.description: The dictionary key of the asset control field.

assets.description: Asset IDs (which may be wildcarded) that may provide the control field. For asset ability enhancements, `null` is used to represent the asset's own control fields.

AssetOptionValueRef.description: A reference to the value of an asset option.

option.description: The dictionary key of the asset option field.

AttachedAssetControlValueRef.title: AttachedAssetControlValueRef
AttachedAssetControlValueRef.description: A reference to the value of an attached asset control. For example, a Module asset could use this to roll using the `integrity` control of an attached Vehicle.

AttachedAssetOptionValueRef.description: A reference to the value of an attached asset option.

option.description: The dictionary key of the asset option field.

ConditionMeterValueRef.title: ConditionMeterValueRef
ConditionMeterValueRef.description: A reference to the value of a standard player condition meter.

using.description: A reference to the value of a standard player condition meter.

CustomValue.title: CustomValue
CustomValue.description: An arbitrary static integer value with a label.

using.description: An arbitrary static integer value with a label.

RollableValue.description: Provides a value like a stat, condition meter, or other number (usually for use in an action roll). The expected value is an integer, or null.

StatValueRef.description: A reference to the value of a standard player character stat.

using.description: A reference to the value of a standard player character stat.

Npc.title: Npc
Npc.description: A non-player character entry, similar to those in Chapter 5 of the Ironsworn Rulebook, or Chapter 4 of Starforged.

_id.description: The unique Datasworn ID for this item.

name.description: The primary name/label for this item.

canonical_name.description: The name of this item as it appears on the page in the book, if it's different from `name`.

rank.description: The suggested challenge rank for this NPC.

_comment.description: Any implementation hints or other developer-facing comments on this object. These should be omitted when presenting the object for gameplay.

_source.description: Attribution for the original source (such as a book or website) of this item, including the author and licensing information.

_id.description: The unique Datasworn ID for this item.

name.description: The primary name/label for this item.

canonical_name.description: The name of this item as it appears on the page in the book, if it's different from `name`.

replaces.description: This collection replaces the identified collection. References to the replaced collection can be considered equivalent to this collection.

enhances.description: This collection's content enhances the identified collection, rather than being a standalone collection of its own.

color.description: A thematic color associated with this collection.

icon.description: An SVG icon associated with this collection.

items.description: Extra images associated with this collection.

summary.description: A brief summary of this collection, no more than a few sentences in length. This is intended for use in application tooltips and similar sorts of hints. Longer text should use the "description" key instead.

description.description: A longer description of this collection, which might include multiple paragraphs. If it's only a couple sentences, use the `summary` key instead.

NpcNature.title: NpcNature
NpcNature.description:
A localized category label describing the nature of this NPC.

In Ironsworn classic, this is probably the singular form of the parent collection's name.

For Starforged, see the table on p. 258 for examples.

_id.description: The unique Datasworn ID for this item.

rank.description: The suggested challenge rank for this NPC.

_comment.description: Any implementation hints or other developer-facing comments on this object. These should be omitted when presenting the object for gameplay.

DiceExpression.title: DiceExpression
DiceExpression.description: A simple dice roll expression with an optional modifer.

OracleDuplicateBehavior.title: OracleDuplicateBehavior
OracleDuplicateBehavior.description:
Special roll instructions to use when rolling multiple times on a single oracle.

  - `reroll`: Duplicate results should be re-rolled.
  - `keep`: Duplicates results should be kept.
  - `make_it_worse`: Duplicate results should be kept, and they compound to make things worse.

oracle.description: The ID of the oracle to be rolled. A `null` value indicates that it's a roll on the same table.

dice.description: The dice roll to make on the oracle table. Set it to `null` if you just want the table's default.

auto.description: Both Ironsworn and Starforged explicitly recommend *against* rolling all details at once. That said, some oracle results only provide useful information once a secondary roll occurs, such as "Action + Theme" or "Roll twice".

duplicates.description: Special rules on how to handle duplicate results, when rolling multiple times.

number_of_rolls.description: The number of times to roll.

OracleRollTemplate.title: OracleRollTemplate
OracleRollTemplate.description:
Provides string templates that may be used in place of the static row text from `OracleTableRow#text`, `OracleTableRow#text2`, and `OracleTableRow#text3`.

  These strings are formatted in Markdown, but use a special syntax for their placeholders: `{{text:some_oracle_table_id}}`. The placeholder should be replaced with the value of a rolled (or selected) `OracleTableRow#text` from the target oracle table ID.

text.description: A string template that may be used in place of OracleTableRow#text.

text2.description: A string template that may be used in place of OracleTableRow#text2.

text3.description: A string template that may be used in place of OracleTableRow#text3.

OracleCollection.title: OracleCollection
OracleCollection.remarks: Deserialize as a discriminated union/polymorphic object type, using the `oracle_type` property as a discriminator.

OracleColumnText.title: OracleColumnText
OracleColumnText.description: Represents a single column in an OracleCollection.

_id.description: The unique Datasworn ID for this item.

name.description: The primary label at the head of this column.

replaces.description: Indicates that this object replaces the identified OracleRollable. References to the replaced object can be considered equivalent to this object.

color.description: An optional thematic color for this column. For an example, see "Basic Creature Form" (Starforged p. 337)

icon.description: An optional icon for this column.

dice.description: The roll used to select a result on this oracle.

summary.description: Optional secondary text at the head of this column. For best results, this should be no more than a few words in length.

match.description: Most oracle tables are insensitive to matches, but a few define special match behavior.

_comment.description: Any implementation hints or other developer-facing comments on this object. These should be omitted when presenting the object for gameplay.

rows.description: An array of objects, each representing a single row of the table.

OracleTableRowText.title: OracleTableRowText
OracleTableRowText.description: Represents a row in an oracle table, with a single text cell.

min.description: Low end of the dice range for this table row. `null` represents an unrollable row, included only for rendering purposes.

anyOf.description: Low end of the dice range for this table row.

max.description: High end of the dice range for this table row. `null` represents an unrollable row, included only for rendering purposes.

anyOf.description: High end of the dice range for this table row.

text.description: The primary text content of this row.

embed_table.description: Hints that the identified table should be rendered inside this table row.

oracle_rolls.description: Further oracle rolls prompted by this table row.

OracleTableRowText2.title: OracleTableRowText2
OracleTableRowText2.description: Represents a row in an oracle table that provides a secondary text field.

min.description: Low end of the dice range for this table row. `null` represents an unrollable row, included only for rendering purposes.

anyOf.description: Low end of the dice range for this table row.

max.description: High end of the dice range for this table row. `null` represents an unrollable row, included only for rendering purposes.

anyOf.description: High end of the dice range for this table row.

text.description: The primary text content of this row.

text2.description: The secondary text for this row. Use `null` to represent a cell with a blank or empty vlue.

embed_table.description: Hints that the identified table should be rendered inside this table row.

oracle_rolls.description: Further oracle rolls prompted by this table row.

OracleTableRowText3.title: OracleTableRowText3
OracleTableRowText3.description: Represents a row in an oracle table with 3 text cells.

min.description: Low end of the dice range for this table row. `null` represents an unrollable row, included only for rendering purposes.

anyOf.description: Low end of the dice range for this table row.

max.description: High end of the dice range for this table row. `null` represents an unrollable row, included only for rendering purposes.

anyOf.description: High end of the dice range for this table row.

text.description: The primary text content of this row.

text2.description: The secondary text for this row. Use `null` to represent a cell with a blank or empty vlue.

text3.description: The tertiary text for this row. Use `null` to represent a cell with a blank or empty vlue.

oracle_rolls.description: Further oracle rolls prompted by this table row.

OracleTableSharedRolls.title: OracleTableSharedRolls
OracleTableSharedRolls.description: An OracleCollection representing a single table with one roll column and multiple `result` columns.

_id.description: The unique Datasworn ID for this item.

name.description: The primary name/label for this item.

canonical_name.description: The name of this item as it appears on the page in the book, if it's different from `name`.

oracle_type.description: A table with one shared roll column, and multiple unique text columns.

replaces.description: This collection replaces the identified collection. References to the replaced collection can be considered equivalent to this collection.

enhances.description: This collection's content enhances the identified collection, rather than being a standalone collection of its own.

color.description: A thematic color associated with this collection.

icon.description: An SVG icon associated with this collection.

items.description: Extra images associated with this collection.

summary.description: A brief summary of this collection, no more than a few sentences in length. This is intended for use in application tooltips and similar sorts of hints. Longer text should use the "description" key instead.

description.description: A longer description of this collection, which might include multiple paragraphs. If it's only a couple sentences, use the `summary` key instead.

column_labels.title: ColumnLabels
column_labels.description: Provides column labels for this table. The `roll` key refers to the roll column showing the dice range (`min` and `max` on each table row). For all other column labels, see the `name` property of each child `OracleColumn`.

_comment.description: Any implementation hints or other developer-facing comments on this object. These should be omitted when presenting the object for gameplay.

_source.description: Attribution for the original source (such as a book or website) of this item, including the author and licensing information.

OracleTableText.title: OracleTableText

ActionRollMethod.title: ActionRollMethod
ActionRollMethod.description:
- `miss`: An automatic miss.
  - `weak_hit`: An automatic weak hit.
  - `strong_hit`: An automatic strong hit.
  - `player_choice`: The player chooses which roll option to use.
  - `highest`: Use the roll option with the best/highest value.
  - `lowest`: Use the roll option with the worst/lowest value.
  - `all`: Use _every_ roll option at once.

MoveActionRollEnhancement.title: MoveActionRollEnhancement
MoveActionRollEnhancement.description: An object that describes changes to a move. These changes should be applied recursively, altering only the specified properties; enhanced arrays should be concatencated with the original array value.

roll_type.description: A move must have this `roll_type` to receive this enhancement. This is in addition to any other restrictions made by other properties.

enhances.description: An array of wildcard IDs. An item must match one of the wildcard IDs to receive this enhancement. If this is `null`, any ID is valid.

MoveOutcomes.title: MoveOutcomes
MoveOutcomes.description:
A standalone localized description for each move outcome (miss, weak hit, or strong hit). This is for for e.g. VTT implementations, where it's often useful to display only the rules text relevant to a roll result.

  This often requires light editorialization to create text that can stand alone without reference to the rest of the move. For example, 'as above' (in reference to another move outcome) shouldn't be used here; instead, the relevant text should be repeated.

MoveProgressRoll.title: MoveProgressRoll
MoveProgressRoll.description: A progress move that rolls on a standard progress track type (whose features are defined by this move object). For progress rolls that use special tracks, see MoveSpecialTrack.

MoveRollType.title: MoveRollType
MoveRollType.description:
- `no_roll`: A move that makes no action rolls or progress rolls.
  - `action_roll`: A move that makes an action roll.
  - `progress_roll`: A progress move that rolls on a standard progress track type (defined by this move).
  - `special_track`: A progress move that rolls on one or more special tracks, like Bonds (classic Ironsworn), Failure (Delve), or Legacies (Starforged).

MoveSpecialTrack.title: MoveSpecialTrack
MoveSpecialTrack.description: A progress move that rolls on a special track, such as Legacies (Starforged) or Bonds (classic Ironsworn). For progress moves that use standard progress tracks, see MoveProgressRoll instead.

TriggerActionRoll.title: TriggerActionRoll
TriggerActionRoll.description: Describes trigger conditions for a move that makes an action roll.

conditions.description: Specific conditions that qualify for this trigger.

text.description:
A markdown string containing the primary trigger text for this move.

Secondary trigger text (for specific stats or uses of an asset ability) may be described in individual trigger conditions.

roll_options.description: The options available when rolling with this trigger condition.

text.description: A markdown string of any trigger text specific to this trigger condition.

method.description: A `null` value means this condition provides no roll mechanic of its own; it must be used with another trigger condition that provides a non-null `method`.

anyOf.description: The options available when rolling with this trigger condition.

text.description: A markdown string of any trigger text specific to this trigger condition.

TriggerActionRollEnhancement.title: TriggerActionRollEnhancement
TriggerActionRollEnhancement.description: Describes changes/additions made to the enhanced move's trigger conditions.

conditions.description: Trigger conditions added to the enhanced move.

TriggerBy.title: TriggerBy
TriggerBy.description: Information on who can activate this trigger condition. Usually this is just the player, but some asset abilities can trigger from an ally's move.

ally.description: Can this trigger be activated by one of the player's allies?

player.description: Can this trigger be activated by the player who owns this?

_id.description: The unique Datasworn ID for this item.

name.description: The primary name/label for this item.

canonical_name.description: The name of this item as it appears on the page in the book, if it's different from `name`.

category.description: A localized category label for this asset. This is the surtitle above the asset's name on the card.

color.description: A thematic color associated with this asset.

icon.description: This asset's icon.

options.description: Options are input fields set when the player purchases the asset. They're likely to remain the same through the life of the asset. Typically, they are rendered at the top of the asset card.

count_as_impact.description: If `true`, this asset counts as an impact (Starforged) or a debility (classic Ironsworn).

shared.description: Most assets only benefit to their owner, but certain assets (like Starforged's module and command vehicle assets) are shared amongst the player's allies, too.

requirement.description: Describes prerequisites for purchasing or using this asset.

items.description: Abilities provided by this asset. Most assets have 3.

controls.description: Controls are condition meters, clocks, counters, and other asset input fields whose values are expected to change throughout the life of the asset.

AssetAbility.title: AssetAbility
AssetAbility.description: An asset ability: one of the purchasable features of an asset. Most assets have three.

_id.description: The unique Datasworn ID for this item.

name.description: A handful of asset abilities have a label/name, for instance classic Ironsworn companion assets. Most canonical assets omit this property.

options.description: Fields that are expected to be set once and remain the same through the life of the asset.

text.description: The complete rules text of this asset ability.

controls.description: Fields whose values are expected to change over the life of the asset.

enhance_asset.description: Changes made to the asset, when this ability is enabled.

_comment.description: Any implementation hints or other developer-facing comments on this object. These should be omitted when presenting the object for gameplay.

enhance_moves.description: Describes changes made to various moves by this asset ability. Usually these require specific trigger conditions.

moves.description: Unique moves added by this asset ability.

AssetAbilityControlField.title: AssetAbilityControlField
AssetAbilityControlField.remarks: Deserialize as a discriminated union/polymorphic object type, using the `field_type` property as a discriminator.

AssetAbilityOptionField.title: AssetAbilityOptionField
AssetAbilityOptionField.remarks: Deserialize as a discriminated union/polymorphic object type, using the `field_type` property as a discriminator.

AssetAttachment.title: AssetAttachment
AssetAttachment.description: Describes which assets can be attached to this asset. Example: Starforged's Module assets, which can be equipped by Command Vehicle assets. See p. 55 of Starforged for more info.

max.description: Null if there's no upper limit to the number of attached assets.

assets.description: Asset IDs (which may be wildcards) that may be attached to this asset

icon.description: An icon associated with this input.

is_impact.description: Does this field count as an impact (Starforged) or debility (Ironsworn classic) when its value is set to `true`?

disables_asset.description: Does this field disable the asset when its value is set to `true`?

icon.description: An icon associated with this input.

disables_asset.description: Does this field disable the asset when its value is set to `true`?

_id.description: The unique Datasworn ID for this item.

name.description: The primary name/label for this item.

canonical_name.description: The name of this item as it appears on the page in the book, if it's different from `name`.

replaces.description: This collection replaces the identified collection. References to the replaced collection can be considered equivalent to this collection.

enhances.description: This collection's content enhances the identified collection, rather than being a standalone collection of its own.

color.description: A thematic color associated with this collection.

icon.description: An SVG icon associated with this collection.

items.description: Extra images associated with this collection.

AssetConditionMeter.title: AssetConditionMeter
AssetConditionMeter.description: Some assets provide a special condition meter of their own. The most common example is the health meters on companion assets. Asset condition meters may also include their own controls, such as the checkboxes that Starforged companion assets use to indicate they are "out of action".

rollable.description: Is this meter's `value` usable as a stat in an action roll?

min.description: The minimum value of this meter.

max.description: The maximum value of this meter.

value.description: The current value of this meter.

icon.description: An icon associated with this input.

controls.description: Checkbox controls rendered as part of the condition meter.

moves.description: Provides hints for moves that interact with this condition meter, such as suffer and recovery moves.

recover.description: The ID(s) of recovery moves associated with this meter.

suffer.description: The ID(s) of suffer moves associated with the condition meter. If the suffer move makes an action roll, this condition meter value should be made available as a roll option.

AssetConditionMeterControlField.title: AssetConditionMeterControlField
AssetConditionMeterControlField.description: A checkbox control field, rendered as part of an asset condition meter.
AssetConditionMeterControlField.remarks: Deserialize as a discriminated union/polymorphic object type, using the `field_type` property as a discriminator.

AssetConditionMeterEnhancement.title: AssetConditionMeterEnhancement
AssetConditionMeterEnhancement.description: Some assets provide a special condition meter of their own. The most common example is the health meters on companion assets. Asset condition meters may also include their own controls, such as the checkboxes that Starforged companion assets use to indicate they are "out of action".

max.description: The maximum value of this meter.

AssetControlField.title: AssetControlField
AssetControlField.remarks: Deserialize as a discriminated union/polymorphic object type, using the `field_type` property as a discriminator.

AssetControlFieldEnhancement.title: AssetControlFieldEnhancement
AssetControlFieldEnhancement.remarks: Deserialize as a discriminated union/polymorphic object type, using the `field_type` property as a discriminator.

AssetEnhancement.title: AssetEnhancement
AssetEnhancement.description: Describes enhancements made to this asset in a partial asset object. The changes should be applied recursively; only the values that are specified should be changed.

count_as_impact.description: If `true`, this asset counts as an impact (Starforged) or a debility (classic Ironsworn).

shared.description: Most assets only benefit to their owner, but certain assets (like Starforged's module and command vehicle assets) are shared amongst the player's allies, too.

controls.description: Controls are condition meters, clocks, counters, and other asset input fields whose values are expected to change throughout the life of the asset.

AssetOptionField.title: AssetOptionField
AssetOptionField.description: Options are asset input fields which are set once, usually when the character takes the asset. The most common example is the "name" field on companion assets. A more complex example is the choice of a god's stat for the Devotant asset.
AssetOptionField.remarks: Deserialize as a discriminated union/polymorphic object type, using the `field_type` property as a discriminator.

ClockField.title: ClockField
ClockField.description: A clock with 4 or more segments.
ClockField.remarks: Semantics are similar to HTML `<input type="number">`, but rendered as a clock (a circle with equally sized wedges).

min.description: The minimum number of filled clock segments. This is always 0.

max.title: ClockSize
max.description: The size of the clock -- in other words, the maximum number of filled clock segments. Standard clocks have 4, 6, 8, or 10 segments.

value.description: The current value of this input.

icon.description: An icon associated with this input.

ConditionMeterField.title: ConditionMeterField
ConditionMeterField.description: A meter with an integer value, bounded by a minimum and maximum.

rollable.description: Is this meter's `value` usable as a stat in an action roll?

min.description: The minimum value of this meter.

max.description: The maximum value of this meter.

value.description: The current value of this meter.

icon.description: An icon associated with this input.

CounterField.title: CounterField
CounterField.description: A basic counter representing a non-rollable integer value. They usually start at 0, and may or may not have a maximum.
CounterField.remarks: Semantics are similar to `<input type="number" step="1">`

max.description: The (inclusive) maximum value, or `null` if there's no maximum.

value.description: The current value of this input.

icon.description: An icon associated with this input.

SelectEnhancementField.title: SelectEnhancementField
SelectEnhancementField.description: Select from player and/or asset enhancements. Use it to describe modal abilities. For examples, see Ironclad (classic Ironsworn) and Windbinder (Sundered Isles).
SelectEnhancementField.remarks: Semantics are similar to the HTML `<select>` element

^([a-z][a-z_]*)$.remarks: Deserialize as a discriminated union/polymorphic object type, using the `choice_type` property as a discriminator.

value.description: The current value of this input.

anyOf.description: The key of the currently selected choice from the `choices` property, or `null` if none is selected.

icon.description: An icon associated with this input.

SelectEnhancementFieldChoice.title: SelectEnhancementFieldChoice
SelectEnhancementFieldChoice.description: Represents an option in a list of choices.
SelectEnhancementFieldChoice.remarks: Semantics are similar to the HTML `<option>` element.

SelectEnhancementFieldChoiceGroup.title: SelectEnhancementFieldChoiceGroup
SelectEnhancementFieldChoiceGroup.description: Represents a grouping of options in a list of choices.
SelectEnhancementFieldChoiceGroup.remarks: Semantics are similar to the HTML `<optgroup>` element.

name.description: A label for this option group.

SelectValueField.title: SelectValueField
SelectValueField.description: Represents a list of mutually exclusive choices.
SelectValueField.remarks: Semantics are similar to the HTML `<select>` element

value.description: The current value of this input.

anyOf.description: The key of the currently selected choice from the `choices` property, or `null` if none is selected.

icon.description: An icon associated with this input.

Rarity.title: Rarity
Rarity.description: A rarity, as described in Ironsworn: Delve.

_id.description: The unique Datasworn ID for this item.

name.description: The primary name/label for this item.

canonical_name.description: The name of this item as it appears on the page in the book, if it's different from `name`.

xp_cost.description:
From Ironsworn: Delve, p. 174:

      Some assets will bring a rarity into play more often than others, so the experience point cost for a rarity will vary by the linked asset. These costs are shown in the tables on page 175.

      If you are playing solo, and aren’t concerned with the relative balance of rarity abilities, you can ignore these variable costs. If so, spend 3 experience points to purchase a rarity.

asset.description: The asset augmented by this rarity.

max.description: High end of the dice range for this denizen.
